Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Percutaneous Laser Ablation for Invasive Ductal Breast Carcinoma

Participants.evidence: women aged 18-80 with a single focus of IDC ≤20 mm were enrolled

Intervention.evidence: Participants underwent PLA, followed by a 28-day post-ablation MRI and surgical resection

Objective.evidence: assessed the efficacy of percutaneous laser ablation (PLA) for invasive ductal carcinoma (IDC)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was complete tumor ablation, evaluated by pathology

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between June 2012 and May 2015, 61 patients were treated

Number_Analysed.evidence: Complete tumor ablation was confirmed in 51 (84%) patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: MRI negative predictive value of 92.2% (95% CI, 71.9–91.9%)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild to moderate, with no serious events reported
